goal: Enhance pure-ralph to select and invoke the appropriate dev-team worker for each task
success_criteria: Each task executed by specialist worker with audit trail and optional PRD overrides

features.title: Add worker selection logic to pure-ralph-base.md
features.description: Add instructions for selecting the appropriate dev-team worker for each task based on keywords, files, and PRD hints
acceptance_criteria: prompts/pure-ralph-base.md includes Worker Selection section
Instructions specify: after picking task, determine best worker
Selection criteria documented: task keywords, target files, PRD hints
Lists available dev-team workers with their specialties
Explains when each worker type applies
features.notes: Worker: knowledge-curator. Selection reason: Documentation/prompt update task. Added Worker Selection section with: selection criteria (PRD hints, target files, keywords), table of all 12 dev-team workers with specialties/keywords/file patterns, usage guidelines for when to use each worker, and 4-step selection process.

features.title: Add PRD worker override support
features.description: Document optional worker field in PRD task JSON for manual override of automatic selection
acceptance_criteria: prompts/pure-ralph-base.md documents optional worker field in task JSON
If worker field present, use that worker instead of auto-selecting
If worker field absent, Claude selects based on criteria
Example shown in prompt: worker: backend-dev
features.notes: Worker: knowledge-curator. Selection reason: Documentation/prompt update task. Added PRD Task Schema section with full JSON schema showing optional worker field. Documented override behavior (present=use it, absent=auto-select). Added use cases and example overrides including backend-dev.

features.title: Add worker invocation instructions to prompt
features.description: Document how to fully invoke a worker within the loop - loading worker.yaml and following skills
acceptance_criteria: prompts/pure-ralph-base.md includes Worker Invocation section
Instructions: read worker.yaml from workers/dev-team/{worker}/
Instructions: follow worker's skills and execution patterns
Instructions: apply worker's knowledge base if referenced
Worker context is used for implementation, not just reference
features.notes: Worker: knowledge-curator. Selection reason: Documentation/prompt update task. Added Worker Invocation section with: 4-step invocation process (load definition, load context, apply instructions, use skills), YAML examples showing context.base and instructions fields, checklist for pre-implementation verification, emphasis that worker context shapes HOW to implement.

features.title: Add worker selection reasoning to task notes
features.description: Specify that task notes must include which worker was selected and why for audit trail
acceptance_criteria: prompts/pure-ralph-base.md specifies notes format includes worker info
Notes must include: Worker: {worker-id}
Notes must include: Selection reason: {brief explanation}
Example provided in prompt
features.notes: Worker: knowledge-curator. Selection reason: Documentation/prompt update task. Added 'Notes Format (Required)' subsection to PRD Updates with: required format spec (Worker + Selection reason + summary), three concrete examples for different worker types (backend-dev, frontend-dev, knowledge-curator), and separated required vs optional note content.

features.title: Create worker selection reference table
features.description: Add quick reference table mapping keywords and file patterns to recommended workers
acceptance_criteria: prompts/pure-ralph-base.md includes worker reference table
Table maps: keywords/patterns to recommended worker
Covers all 12 dev-team workers
Includes file extension hints (e.g., .tsx to frontend-dev, .sql to database-dev)
features.notes: Worker: knowledge-curator. Selection reason: Documentation/prompt update task. Added 'Worker Quick Reference' section with three tables: (1) By File Extension - 17 extension patterns mapped to workers including .tsx to frontend-dev, .sql to database-dev, .test.ts to qa-tester, etc. (2) By Directory Pattern - 12 directory patterns mapped to workers. (3) By Keyword Pattern - 35 keyword patterns mapped to all 12 dev-team workers. Covers architect, backend-dev, frontend-dev, database-dev, qa-tester, infra-dev, motion-designer, code-reviewer, knowledge-curator, project-manager, task-executor, and product-planner.

metadata.purpose: Integrate dev-team workers into pure-ralph loop
